comment.author: 92284803@N00
comment._content: According to Wikipedia, "William Cox Redfield (June 18, 1858 – June 13, 1932) was a Democratic politician from New York. He served as the first United States Secretary of Commerce from 1913 to 1919 after the division of the Department of Commerce and Labor."

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks, bior, for the full name and biographical information. We'll add information to the description when we update it. I spotted quite a few additional images relating to Redfield in checking our Prints & Photographs Online Catalog to look for a match on his face (whiskers!)--including some cartoons relating to his Department of Commerce activities, a portrait of his wife, and a study of his feet(!) -- sharkskin shoes apparently being the matter of interest: www.loc.gov/pictures/search/?q=william+cox+redfield&s...
